title: Kairos: The Art of Perfect Timing
description: A short lesson to help you apply Kairos: The Art of Perfect Timing.

hook.text: The Greeks had two words for time: chronos (clock time) and kairos (the perfect moment). Rhetoric lives in kairos.

buildup.text: Kairos is the rhetorical concept of timing ‚Äî saying the right thing at the right moment in the right way for maximum.

discovery.text: MLK's 'I Have a Dream' speech worked because of kairos: the March on Washington, national tension, and a quarter.

twist.text: Great arguments delivered at the wrong time fail. Mediocre arguments at the perfect moment succeed.

punchline.text: The best words at the wrong time are wasted.
